div.l: cepheus and bootes now
after that the swallow
maenalus mountain next
after that the furious lynx
high up there is scorpio
after that it king leo
the cameleopard appeareth high
next to it the little fly
the serpent serpent serpent bearer then
next to it the butting ram
sobieskis shield up there
after it the charioteer
the bull of poniatowski then
then next the very pretty crane
antinous and arrow soon
after it the southern crown
the dolphin swimming through the air
next to it the altar
the hounds the bull are seen up there
after it the of air
the lesser lion next we see
next to it the armed bee
perseus pegasus then
after it the chamelion
andromeda is seen on high
then then the virgin in the sky
ten starred triangle doth appear
the horn the horn the unicorn doth bear
shining in the golden light he’s drest
with at horn instead of towering crest
the scales that nothing to weigh would bear
but yet certain a thousand more
farther than that I could not say
he’s more than the lofty beautiful milky way
the archer with his flying dart
I should not think it would pierce the heart
the crab and the twins with their clothes of fire
I wish I had not observed the lyre
the little triangle apears on high
and the goat that is formed in the arched sky
I end end

but let history unfold
her page of learning let us see
whether that is not more bright than thee
een thou o beauteous mercury
o much better than the brightest star

better than history indeed
virtue you shall should have the lead
